Package index

Core Simulation Functions

Main functions for simulating longitudinal data

margot_simulate()
Simulate semi-markovian longitudinal data with sampling weights
margot_simulate_causal()
Simulate data for causal inference with proper censoring
margot_simulate_flex()
Enhanced margot_simulate with flexible distributions
apply_censoring_post_hoc()
Apply censoring to complete data
print(<margot_causal_sim>)
Print method for margot_causal_sim

Shadowing Framework

Functions for applying observational distortions

create_shadow()
Shadowing Framework for margot
apply_shadow()
Apply a shadow to data
apply_shadows()
Apply multiple shadows sequentially
combine_shadows()
Create a complex shadow combining multiple distortions
analyse_shadow_effects()
Compare data before and after shadowing
create_item_missingness_shadow()
Create item-level missingness shadow
create_positivity_shadow()
Create positivity violation shadow
diagnose_shadowing()
Quick diagnostic for a shadowed dataset
print(<shadow_effects>)
Print shadow effects

Shadow Methods

S3 methods for specific shadow types

apply_shadow(<censoring_shadow>)
Apply censoring shadow
apply_shadow(<combined_shadow>)
Apply combined shadow
apply_shadow(<item_missingness_shadow>)
Apply item-level missingness shadow
apply_shadow(<measurement_error_shadow>)
Apply measurement error shadow
apply_shadow(<positivity_shadow>)
Apply positivity violation shadow
apply_shadow(<selection_shadow>)
Apply selection bias shadow

Monte Carlo Framework

Functions for Monte Carlo evaluation

margot_monte_carlo()
Monte Carlo Framework for margot
compare_mc_results()
Compare multiple Monte Carlo results
plot(<margot_mc_results>)
Plot Monte Carlo results
print(<margot_mc_results>)
Print method for Monte Carlo results
summary(<margot_mc_results>)
Summary method for Monte Carlo results
print(<mc_comparison>)
Print method for MC comparison

Distribution Specifications

Functions for flexible distributions

create_distribution()
Flexible Distribution Specifications for margot
create_distribution_set()
Create a set of distributions for different variable types
generate_from_dist()
Generate values from a distribution specification
check_distribution()
Check if a variable follows a specified distribution
margot_distributions
Common distribution specifications
generate_from_dist(<custom_distribution>)
Generate from custom distribution function
generate_from_dist(<parametric_distribution>)
Generate from parametric distribution

Helper functions and documentation

Report margot simulation summary

Display detailed SCM equations

Create SCM diagram

Validate SCM assumptions in simulated data

Convert margot data between wide and long formats
margot_extract_var()
Extract variable at specific time point
margot_missingness_summary()
Get summary of missingness patterns
